file_content.text: The observatory's already feeding us our enemies' intel. Thank you again.
I deployed the conversion equipment. The observatory's all yours.
I can't thank you enough. You've given House Organa the chance to gain a footing in this war.
Organa will succeed.
Our fight's just beginning. You've helped us immensely.
Any plans?
We fight back. You've given us the means to do so.
Your talk's tiresome.
I'm sorry--I've taken enough of your time.
House Organa won't be the easy target we once were.
Our enemies have caught us off guard for the last time.
General Linel Organa, at your service. My colleague, General Kashim, said a field agent was in the area. I'm glad you've stopped by.
Glad to have you. I'm General Linel Organa. I requested properly trained troops, but there must be a shortage. You'll do even better.
House Organa needs someone with your esteemed combat experience, Master Jedi.
Anything for a loyal servant of the Republic.
It's my duty to assist.
That's good to hear, master. My men could use a good display of power.
My experience lies with the Force. No one will serve you better.
You have my complete support.
My thanks, master. I'm sure you'll put the fighting spirit in my men.
If you can spare a moment, sir, House Organa requires someone with your military experience.
If you need a battle-hardened veteran, you're talking to the right soldier.
Look no further.
That's a relief, sir. Way my men fight, you'd think most of them have never seen a blaster.
House Organa would appreciate the services of someone with your combat experience.
A Jedi's your strongest asset in difficult times.
You should be talking to me.
The Force will serve you better than a lifetime of battle skills.
You should be talking to me.
I'm the combat expert in this crowd.
You should be talking to me.
Yes, of course. We need every hand we can get.
I've got all the experience you need. Want to see my rates?
Desperate enough to pay?
Don't worry. We have the funds. It's the know-how we lack.
Why so desperate?
Doesn't concern me.
Please... my men are doing their best, but they aren't ready for action yet.
Organa's soft after generations of pacifism, and now Thul and Ulgo are too far ahead.
Spying didn't work--Thul destroyed every probe sent their way. But our engineers have had a breakthrough.
They found a way to convert our old observatory to intercept enemy communications. Unfortunately, Killiks have now overrun the site.
Insects or not, we need that conversion equipment deployed. The observatory's our best shot at pulling ahead of the competition.
Your observatory will be functioning in no time.
I'll take care of it.
Sounds simple enough.
Thank you.
Fight your way through those Killik hordes and set up this equipment. When you're done, we'll hear everything our enemies say.
Maybe you can sucker the next passerby into helping you.
Tough luck. [Refuse quest]
I see. Well... I won't waste any more of your time.
The war's growing darker, and we're not ready for it.
